intro: Calostemma, commonly known as the "moon orchid," is a genus of flowering plants native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae and is characterized by its unique, showy flowers that resemble orchids. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Calostemma species are known for their fragrant, tubular flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. These plants are often cultivated for their ornamental value and are relatively easy to care for in suitable climates.
